metadata.Title: CVE-2016-10207 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.Description:
The Xvnc server in TigerVNC allows remote attackers to cause a denial ofservice (invalid memory access and crash) by terminating a TLS handshakeearly.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-10207` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

tigervnc-common - 1.7.0+dfsg-8ubuntu2
tigervnc-scraping-server - 1.7.0+dfsg-8ubuntu2
tigervnc-standalone-server - 1.7.0+dfsg-8ubuntu2
tigervnc-viewer - 1.7.0+dfsg-8ubuntu2
tigervnc-xorg-extension - 1.7.0+dfsg-8ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tigervnc package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.7.0+dfsg-8ubuntu2').
